description: England beat Malawi in their second Pool B match at the Netball World Cup in Cape Town - follow BBC radio commentary and live text updates.
title: Netball World Cup 2023 LIVE: England beat Malawi- score, commentary & updates in Pool B game
title_page: Netball World Cup 2023 LIVE: England beat Malawi- score, commentary & updates in Pool B game - BBC Sport
maintext:
Cheerio!
A comfortable victory in terms of the scoreline but plenty for Jess Thirlby's England side to work on heading into their final Pool B match against Scotland on Sunday.
Their place in the next phase is all but secured but victory tomorrow will see them top the group with results from this stage carried over to the next.
We'll be back with live text and radio commentary from around 15:00 BST tomorrow - until then you can keep up with everything netball here.
Thanks for joining us, see you soon!
'First quarter not good enough'
FT: England 62-39 Malawi
England shooter and player of the match Helen Housby speaking on Sky Sports:
"We have been trying to work on our connection. When the crowd is so loud sometimes you can't hear each other so you should be able to know where your team-mate is going. We have gone from strength to strength on that.
"The first quarter wasn't good enough for us so we'll certainly be looking at that."
'Lots to work on'
FT: England 62-39 Malawi
Ama Agbeze
Former England captain on BBC Radio 5 Live
When they come up against say Australia and New Zealand the physical pressure is going to be immense.
You might only have a split second to make a decision and let the ball go, when you have the ball you need to categorically take it to goal.
In this game there were lots of errors, there were lots of dropped passes and people pulling the ball way in front of team-mates. There were lots of balls splayed off the backline and that's not the level of play that England expect from themselves or that Jess Thirlby will want.
She is a perfectionist, she will be frustrated - happy with the win but lots to work on.
England get the job done
That victory also marks England's 100th at a World Cup, not bad.
They probably won't care about that - they got the job done here, despite having a few things to clean up on in the coming days.
Next up they face Scotland in their final Pool B match and victory there will see them top the group which will stand them in excellent stead for the next stage, where results from these matches are carried over.
Metcalf praises 'awesome' shooters
FT: England 62-39 Malawi
England captain Nat Metcalf speaking on Sky Sports after the win:
"Awesome for us [to have 95% shooting accuracy], something we want to keep building on. Whichever combination is in there they've been doing awesome so we just need to get the ball to them.
"When we won ball we really grew into the game - Malawi are an incredible side and happy with the ball so it's really hard to win possession from them. So as we grew into the game we started to do that and take care of it."
FULL-TIME
Q4: England 62-39 Malawi
Ahh that's a shame! Liv Tchine wanted a repeat of last night where she quickly put the ball in the net to bring up 90 goals for her side.
This time it was to take their tally to 63 goals but the whistle had already blown for a contact call in the build-up.
One second on the clock and Malawi punt it up court out of danger as the buzzer sounds.
Job done for England.
Post
Q4: England 51-32 Malawi
A goal apiece for England's shooters as Nat Metcalf brings up the 50 goals for the Roses.
One thing to note about having Chelsea Pitman at wing attack and Liv Tchine at goal shooter is that they play together domestically at London Pulse. They have had a ridiculously good season together and know each other well. That can only be a good thing for England.
Post
Q3: England 48-29 Malawi
Less than one minute to go in this third quarter as England continue to make in-roads.
Victory here sets England well on track to top Pool B. Their spot in the next stage of the tournament is all but secured but results are carried over which means they will want to win, and win comfortably, in these Pool B matches.
